oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Hallmarks of Country Music - Don Gibson
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of an interview of Don Gibson (musician). The interview is hosted by Rick Phillips (army sergeant/ radio host) for the Hallmarks of Country Music segment. The tape was recorded on an unidentified date.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Don Gibson; Rick Phillips
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Lonesome Number One [excerpt] [featuring Don Gibson voiceover] (Don Gibson) -- (00:16) Touch the Morning [excerpt] (Don Gibson) -- (00:26) Unidentified [excerpt] (Don Gibson) -- (00:46) Woman [excerpt] (Sensuous Woman) -- (00:51) Sea of Heartbreak [excerpt] (Don Gibson) -- (01:02) Country Green [excerpt] (Don Gibson) -- (01:17) Don Gibson radio spot for the Hallmarks of Country Music Program -- (01:29) Hallmarks tune [featuring Rick Phillips introduction voiceover] ([Unidentified]) -- (02:04) There She Goes (I Wish Her Well) (Don Gibson) -- (03:51) Phillips radio spot about the Reenlistment Bonus Program for the military -- (04:47) I Can't Stop Loving You (Don Gibson) -- (07:47) Phillips introduces Don Gibson, and both reflect on the various recordings of ""I Can't Stop Loving You"" -- (10:51) Oh Lonesome Me (Don Gibson) -- (13:23) Soldiers Magazine commercial spot hosted by an unidentified voice -- (14:15) Just One Time (Don Gibson) -- (16:22) Gibson and Phillips discuss the 'mark' of a great song; additionally, Gibson discusses his lack of musical background -- (19:55) Lonesome Number 1 (Don Gibson) -- (22:01) Red Cross radio spot hosted by Henry Fonda -- (22:59) Phillips military radio spot -- (23:22) Sweet Dreams (Don Gibson) -- (26:36) Phillips inquires as to when Gibson wrote ""Sweet Dreams,"" and both discuss singer/song-writers while reflecting on ""Legend in My Time"" -- (29:57) Legend in My Time (Don Gibson) -- (32:25) Military radio spot hosted by Phillips -- (33:18) Country Green (Don Gibson) -- (35:27) Mac flight information radio spot hosted by Phillips -- (36:05) Touch the Morning (Don Gibson) -- (38:56) Phillips and Gibson reflect on the influence of Wesley Rose on Gibson's career; additionally, Gibson's reserved nature is touched on -- (41:12) Funny, Familiar, Forgotten, Feelings (Don Gibson) -- (43:30) Phillips introduces ""Good Morning, Dear"" -- (43:37) Good Morning, Dear (Don Gibson) -- (46:17) Refugee information commercial spot hosted by Phillips -- (46:54) Woman (Sensuous Woman) (Don Gibson) -- (49:57) Phillips inquires as to how Gibson was introduced to ""Woman (Sensuous Woman);"" additionally, Gibson reflects on what has helped him reach continuous success -- (52:22) I'll Sing For You (Don Gibson) -- (54:17) Hallmarks outro tune [featuring Phillips outro voiceover] ([Unidentified])
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:isPartOf: Insert is of program information. The insert features time stamps.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Gibson, Don (Donald Eugene), 1928-2003; Phillips, Rick;
